CatDescriptText: Thelma Jordan, 2119 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I don't think that Murtaugh is using his best players.  There are some on the bench who could do a lot better than the ones on the field.  But they are not allowed to get up.  Something is wrong with the..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Jordan wearing dark plaid dress with lace trim and light colored button down sweater with beaded lace style pattern, holding handbag, standing in front of light colored wall, left store window displaying female mannequin wearing light colored sleeveless polka dot dress with dark sheer overlay, store window on right displaying men's dress shoes with sign inscribed "Fr..."
